instruction: Please review the exhibit below and identify which five metrics are used to assess the level of "bubbliness" in stocks and portfolios.
output: Based on the framework proposed, the five metrics that are used to identify the level of "bubbliness" in stocks and portfolios are as follows: (1) Price-to-Earnings (P/E) Ratio, (2) Price-to-Sales (P/S) Ratio, (3) Price-to-Book (P/B) Ratio, (4) Dividend Yield, and (5) Market Capitalization-to-Gross Domestic Product (Mkt Cap-to-GDP) Ratio.
